post.summary: backs up the server keystore for later restoration

get.summary: returns a cached csr, or blank if there is no cached csr
returns lots of different fields about the certificate
returns array of certificates that form the chain of the signed certificate
return certificate signing request from server keystore with pml alias

parameters.name: ext
parameters.description: a value of 'true' will add extensions to the CSR

post.summary: generate a certificate for this node to be used by the database

parameters.name: san
parameters.description: The Subject Alternative Name for the certificate

parameters.name: cn
parameters.description: The Common Name for the certificate

parameters.name: ou
parameters.description: The Organizational Unit for the certificate

get.summary: returns the current distinguished name of the certificate with pml alias

post.summary: forces the server keystore to be distributed to all cluster nodes; this command restarts the server, meaning it will be temporarily unavailable during the restart
imports a CA certificate into the server keystore under a generated alias
imports a CA certificate into the server truststore under a generated alias; this command restarts the server, meaning it will be temporarily unavailable during the restart
used to import a public/private key pair into the server keystore; this command restarts the server, meaning it will be temporarily unavailable during the restart

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The public and private key pair to be imported (with optional privateKeyPass)

post.summary: imports a signed certificate into the server keystore under the 'pml' alias; this command restarts the server, meaning it will be temporarily unavailable during the restart

get.summary: returns information specified by certFile in a serialized form for convenient use in other operations

parameters.name: certFile
parameters.description: the full path to the file to put into serialized form

post.summary: restores the server keystore from a previous backup; this command restarts the server, meaning it will be temporarily unavailable during the restart

get.summary: return certificate information from server keystore with pml alias
return certificate information from server keystore with specified alias

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description: the alias of the certificate to return

delete.summary: deletes the certificate with the specified alias from the server keystore

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description: the alias of the certificate to delete

get.summary: returns array of all certificates in the server keystore

post.summary: generates a new public/private key pair for the PML self-signed certificate; this command restarts the server, meaning it will be temporarily unavailable during the restart

get.summary: Get the certificate for an LDAP server

endTime.description: Time the task completed, if applicable

purposeMessage.description: Localised reason this task was created

clientsAlias.description: The client keystore alias for the certificate for which trust is being requested

clientCertificateFingerprint.description: The fingerprint for the certificate for which trust is being requested

clientCACertificate.description: The signing authority certificate of the signing authority that signed the certificate

serversNameForClient.description: The importing server's name for this client certificate, the external id for this trust request

id.description: The internal id of this trust request

connectionAddress.description: This is the address the trusting server provides which the client can use to connect

clientsAlias.description: This is the alias of the client certificate that this connection will honor

serverCACertificate.description: The signing authority certificate of the signing authority that signed the server's certificate

clientNameForConnection.description: This is the external id for this request

clusterUuid.description: The clusterUuid of the truster automatically added

id.description: The internal id of this trust request

name.description: the name of the current node only supplied if PML has been configured

restReady.description: true if mode is ACTIVE and name is not empty, implication is that PML is setup and ACTIVE

messageForCurrentLocale.description: The error message localised for the requested locale

resolutionForCurrentLocale.description: The resolution details localised for the requested locale

resolution.description: Details of how to resolve the error, if applicable
